original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.45. Ajjhattārammaṇattika, Hetuduka🔽Ajjhattārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… purejāte āsevane dve …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi          ajjhatta ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca na ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe purejāte āsevane dve pe avigate cha
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Triad-Couplet Section of the Conditions

original: Ajjhattārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabahiddhārammaṇo nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na bahiddha ārammaṇaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: With internal condition as condition, an internal non-condition dhammas arises by root condition. (In brief.) With root condition as condition, there are six … With prenascence condition, with postnascence condition, with arising condition, with fall condition, with presence condition, with absence condition, with non-disappearance condition, with internal condition as condition, an internal non-condition dhammas arises by root condition. (In brief.)
